member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the user password when connecting to the email server.

member.name: P:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.EmailModule.SendEmailOnFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to send the mail when the test suite completes with a failure (true or false).
member.remarks: If true Sends an email when the test suite finishes with a failure.

member.name: P:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.EmailModule.SendEmailOnSuccess
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to send the mail when the test suite completes successfully (true or false).
member.remarks: If true Sends an email when the test suite finishes with a success.

member.name: P:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.EmailModule.SendZippedReportOnComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the email should send the report as an attachement when the test suite finishes.

member.name: P:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.EmailModule.SendPdfReportOnComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the email should send the pdf version of the report as an attachement when the test suite finishes.

member.name: P:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.EmailModule.PdfReportCustomStylesheet
member.summary: If is set to true, this can be used to set a custom stylesheet. Don't set or set to an empty string to use the default stylesheet. See https://www.ranorex.com/blog/ranorex-report-to-pdf-conversion#stylesheet

member.name: M:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.EmailModule.Ranorex#Core#Testing#ITestModule#Run
member.summary: Sends the report via email after the test run has completed. Use this module in the TearDown of your test case to ensure that it is executed even on failing test runs.
member.remarks: You should not call this method directly. Instead, pass the module instance to the method that will in turn invoke this method.

member.name: M:Ranorex.AutomationHelpers.Modules.ReportToPDFModule.Ranorex#Core#Testing#ITestModule#Run
member.summary: Converts the Ranorex Report into PDF after the test run completed. Use this module in the TearDown of your TestCase to ensure that it is executed even on failing test runs.
